posts.post_content:
@ Rix\_Maadi
  
   
You are right, it could have been a 3/3 to have made it have a few more potential uses.
  
   
Though I do understand why a card like this may have been chosen to be a 2/2, firstly it is common. Also there was plenty of zombie love in Onslaught (my favorite set for just that reason) and also in black sometimes sacrificing can be a good thing so this card could be potentialy useful in that respect.
  
   
Example: Consider playing a [festering goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=festering goblin) then droping this guy and sacing the festering goblin. Then festering goblin gives -1/-1 to a birds of paradise or any other creatures the opponent controls that have one toughness to destroy it.
  
   
While this card is not great by any means it is primarly due to the fact that they can't all be winners.

posts.post_content:
Are half the people commenting here blind or something? This just says "sacrifice a creature". Not "each player sacrifices a creature." You. Sacrifice. Creature. Why would you even compare it to Innocent Blood?  
  
But yes, this has its uses with [Festering Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Festering Goblin) or [Mogg Fanatic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mogg Fanatic), [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact), [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari), and Threshold or Dredge decks that like getting cards into the graveyard. But there are better things for all those uses.
posts.html:

For all of the uses people have described here, I can't help but point out that Carrion Feeder is superior. It can't block, but it fits the curve at any time and can attack just as well. It sacrifices things at instant speed and multiple times.  
However, I must also point out that this is a ZOMBIE CENTAUR. Like, what the hell?

posts.post_content:
The difference between this and [Innocent Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Innocent Blood) is that this one is a **creature**, meaning it can be the target of various resurrection spells, namely [Phyrexian Reclamation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Reclamation).  
  
One of they key cards in my [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact) zombie deck.
posts.html:
